title: Why is Coronation Street not on tonight and when is it back?
text:
We’ll be away from the cobbles for a little while longer yet… (Picture: ITV)

This is not a drill – Coronation Street will not be on tonight, Friday 11 November.

That means we’ll have to wait until next week to see David (Jack P Shepherd) see his vile rapist again and to see how our Sinead (Katie McGlynn) is coping with her terminal diagnosis.

For anyone in danger of suffering from cobbles withdrawal until then, here’s what you need to know about why Corrie won’t be on, and when it will be back…

Why is Coronation Street not on tonight?

We’re sorry to break it to you, but not only is Corrie cancelled tonight, but it won’t be on again until Wednesday 16 October.

This is because ITV are clearing the airwaves to make way for the UEFA Championship qualifier matches.

Footy fans out there will likely already know that on Friday 11 October, England will be playing against Czech Republic, and on Monday 14 October, England will be going up against Bulgaria.

Advertisement

Advertisement

When Coronation Street hits our screens again, we’ll see pregnant Gemma (Dolly-Rose Campbell) get up to some typical hijinx and wedge herself in a turnstile.

In more serious scenes, and David will come face to face with his rapist Josh (Ryan Clayton) while in prison and Bethany Platt (Lucy Fallon) makes a confession which could make Sinead’s last days even worse than they have to be.

Corrie will be back on Wednesday 16 October.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: We'll be away from the cobbles for a little while longer yet. Here's why Corrie is cancelled tonight....
